generif.text: Mutation analysis revealed a homozygous mutation in the SAMD9 gene (K1495E), which was found to segregate with the disease in all families and to interfere with the protein expression.

SAMD9 and SAMD9L are a novel family of genes, which play a role regulating cell proliferation and suppressing the neoplastic phenotype; the human gene exists in rat, but is lost in mouse, due to a mouse specific rearrangement
PIvotal role in calcification and thus implicated in various hereditary diseases such as atherosclerosis, calcinosis and autoimmune diseases.
SAMD9 may have a role in the TNF-alpha signaling pathway and in the regulation of extra-osseous calcification
SAMD9 could be a key molecule to control cancer cell death by inactivated Sendai virus particle or IFN-beta treatment.
SAMD9, an IFN-gamma-responsive protein, interacts with RGL2 to diminish the expression of EGR1, a protein of direct relevance to the pathogenesis of ectopic calcification and inflammation.
M062 also binds and antagonizes cellular SAMD9 in human cells, suggesting that SAMD9 is a novel innate antiviral factor against poxviruses.
Over-expression of SAMD9 is correlated with the metastasis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
When SAMD9 is stimulated due to failure of the viral antagonism during infection, the resulting antiviral granules exhibit properties different from those of the canonical stress granules.

SAMD9 is down-regulated in non-small cell lung cancer. Knockdown of SAMD9 expression increased the invasion, migration and proliferation in H1299 cells in vitro and overexpression of SAMD9 suppressed proliferation and invasion in A549 cells.
Replication of the K1L(-)C7L(-) mutant vaccinia virus virus was enabled by multiple siRNAs to SAMD9 or WDR6.
SAMD9 mutation is associated with MIRAGE syndrome.

Progressive loss of mutated SAMD9 through the development of monosomy 7 (-7), deletions of 7q (7q-), and secondary somatic loss-of-function (nonsense and frameshift) mutations in SAMD9 rescued the growth-restricting effects of mutant SAMD9 proteins in bone marrow and was associated with increased length of survival.
findings establish SAMD9/SAMD9L mutations as a new class of germline lesions with variable clinical phenotypes, including familial MDS

Acquisition of a somatic nonsense SAMD9 mutation in the cells of the haematopoietic system might revert the cellular growth repression caused by the germline SAMD9 mutations (ie, second-site reversion mutations). Unexpected lack of haematological features in the two patients would be explained by the reversion mutations.

Here we describe one patient with a novel de novo mutation p.R824Q in SAMD9 and provide functional evidence of its pathogenicity. We also review a second patient with a previously described p.R1293Q mutation with special attention to dysmorphology and findings that could aid in recognition of the disorder.
describe the first patient to present with congenital amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia secondary to MIRAGE syndrome and describe a novel disease-causing SAMD9 allele (c.2462A>T; p.K821M).
In humans, both SAMD9 and SAMD9L are poxvirus restriction factors, although the latter requires interferon induction in many cell types.
REVIEW: expert-based recommendations regarding diagnosis, follow-up, and treatment of mutation carriers.

SAMD9 and SAMD9L germline loss-of-function variants exist in 3% of adult myelodysplastic syndromes and are located more in the N terminus relative to pediatric germline loss-of-function variants, which exist more in the C terminus.
Somatic mosaic monosomy 7 and UPD7q in a child with MIRAGE syndrome caused by a novel SAMD9 mutation.

SAMD9 expression is (epi-) genetically regulated, and significantly upregulated in PBMCs in RA patients and in activated T cells in vitro. SAMD9 might serve as a T cell activation marker but act as an anti-inflammatory factor.
A novel SAMD9 variant identified in patient with MIRAGE syndrome: Further defining syndromic phenotype and review of previous cases.
Homeobox B8 Targets Sterile Alpha Motif Domain-Containing Protein 9 and Drives Glioma Progression.
In trans early mosaic mutational escape and novel phenotypic features of germline SAMD9 mutation.
Prevalence of germline GATA2 and SAMD9/9L variants in paediatric haematological disorders with monosomy 7.
Germline predisposition in myeloid neoplasms: Unique genetic and clinical features of GATA2 deficiency and SAMD9/SAMD9L syndromes.
Pediatric MDS and bone marrow failure-associated germline mutations in SAMD9 and SAMD9L impair multiple pathways in primary hematopoietic cells.
SAMD9 Is Relating With M2 Macrophage and Remarkable Malignancy Characters in Low-Grade Glioma.
Clinical evolution, genetic landscape and trajectories of clonal hematopoiesis in SAMD9/SAMD9L syndromes.
Emerging phenotypes linked to variants in SAMD9 and MIRAGE syndrome.
SAMD9 Promotes Postoperative Recurrence of Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma by Stimulating MYH9-Mediated GSK3beta/beta-Catenin Signaling.
Viral host range factors antagonize pathogenic SAMD9 and SAMD9L variants.
[Pancytopenia in children caused by SAMD9/9L mutation: 5 cases report and literature review].
PARP14 correlates with GBM proliferation and poor prognosis by elevating expression of SAMD/SAMD9L.

name: sterile alpha motif domain containing 9
summary: This gene encodes a sterile alpha motif domain-containing protein. The encoded protein localizes to the cytoplasm and may play a role in regulating cell proliferation and apoptosis. Mutations in this gene are the cause of normophosphatemic familial tumoral calcinosis. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants that encode the same protein.[provided by RefSeq, Jul 2010].
